page.title: 18Law and Order in Jedburgh
page.content: The police station, a sub_station of Hawick ,is open during office hours.If unmanned,when required,one must telephone Hawick who radio to the nearest P.C. to attend .There are eight burgh constables and three traffic department constables .One inspector and three sergeants are shared by Kelso .One sergeant is always on duty.Because of the nature of the town,the police deal mainly with motoring offences ,domestic disputes,and petty crime involving juveniles. There has been an increase in house breaking ,however. The High Court sits in Jedburgh,if required. The Sheriff Court sits on Thursdays if needed.The District Court presided over by justices can deal with minor offences but seldom sits now.
